{{book | title=The History of Middle-earth Index | image = History of Middle-Earth Index (HC2002).png | author=[[J.R.R. Tolkien]] | editor=[[Christopher Tolkien]], [[Helen Armstrong]] | publisher=[[HarperCollins]] | date=[[5 August]] [[2002]] | format=Hardcover; paperback | pages=400 | isbn=0007137435 | precededby=[[The Peoples of Middle-earth]] (1996) | followedby=[[Tolkien and the Great War]] (2003) }} '''''The History of Middle-earth Index''''' is a complete index of the indices from all 12 volumes of ''[[The History of Middle-earth]]''. The volume was compiled by [[Helen Armstrong]]. For ease of reference, there is a separate listing for any entry which appears in more than one of the twelve volumes. In addition to the indices, the accompanying prefatory notes by Christopher Tolkien are also included, which provide further information on the nature and content of the lists of entries. ==From the publisher== {{blockquote|Complete integrated indices of History of Middle-earth volumes to complement new series.
For the first time every index from each of the twelve volumes of The History Of Middle-earth has been published together in a single volume – to create a supreme index charting the writing of Tolkien’s masterpieces The Lord of The Rings and The Silmarillion.
This stunning work of reference complements the fascinating History of Middle-earth series, now repackaged to complement the distinctive and classic style of the ‘black cover’ A-format paperbacks of The Hobbit, The Lord of the Rings, The Silmarillion and Unfinished Tales.}} ==Publication history and gallery== ;UK editions File:History of Middle-Earth Index (HC2002).png|2002 & 2015 paperback File:The History of Middle-earth Index.jpg|2010 hardcover File:The History of Middle-earth Index 2024.jpeg|2024 paperback File:The History of Middle-earth Index hc 2024.jpg|2024 hardcover * [[HarperCollins]] paperback ([[2002]]), pp. 400.
